definition: Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
west
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to move forward/to promote/to advance

sentences.english: Pan Yue was one of the most important representative writers in the Western Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 潘岳是西晉文壇上具有代表性的作家。

sentences.english: Guo Xiang is an important representative of Xuanxue in the West Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 郭象是西晉玄學的重要代表人物。

sentences.english: Western Jin Dynasty established in Nanjing, Qujing becomes one of the country's 19 states.
sentences.chinese: 西晉王朝設寧州，曲靖成爲全國19州之一。

sentences.english: Chicken-headed teapots of the time were vastly different from those of Western Jin.
sentences.chinese: 雞首型茶壺與西晉時期的茶壺有極大的不同。

sentences.english: However from the West Jin to the Southern and Northern dynasties, the nine grades of the families had been fixed.
sentences.chinese: 但是從西晉到南北朝，戶分九品之制已經定型化。

sentences.english: Book of Sheng is an important translation works of Zhu Fahu, a translator during Western Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《生經》是西晉時期譯經家竺法護的重要譯作。

sentences.english: After Western Jin's south unification, some of the Kingdom Wu's system retained.
sentences.chinese: 西晉統一南方後，孫吳舊制還有所保留。

sentences.english: The Qitai Yangge is the typical representative folk drama in central Shanxi.
sentences.chinese: 祁太秧歌是民間小戲在山西晉中的典型代表。

definition: Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Sixteen Kingdoms of Five non-Han people (ruling most of China 304-439)/also written 五胡十六國|五胡十六国
Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
Jin Dynasty (265-420)
Gong county in Henan
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Eastern Wei of the Northern dynasties (534-550), formed from the break-up of Wei of the Northern Dynasties 北魏
Five Dynasties (907-960) and Ten Kingdoms (902-979), period of political turmoil in ancient China
Qi of Southern dynasties (479-502)

History of Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4] or Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], sixth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Shen Yue 沈約|沈约[Shen2 Yue4] in 488 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 100 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋史[Song4 shi3])
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
